data.title: Ice Cream Dilemma
data.statement:
John’s ice cream shop has three different flavours of ice cream: Vanilla, Chocolate, and Strawberry. Customers can only get a maximum of one of each flavour per order. Everyday, before opening, John measures how many scoops of ice cream of each flavour there’s in stock.

However, recently the sales ledger has shown that more ice cream is being sold than there is in stock. John suspects recent applicants on trial-runs have been cheating the customers out of ice cream by giving them smaller scoops, in order to get ahead of the competition.

John has asked you to write some code for him, in order to help catch the candidates red-handed!

If at the end of the day more scoops of ice cream of any flavour(s) have been sold than should be available, output the name of the flavour(s), otherwise output {{Hired}}.

data.stubGenerator:
read V:int C:int S:int
read N:int
loop N read order:string(256)

write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Space-separated integers [[V]], [[C]] and [[S]], for the flavours Vanilla, Chocolate and Strawberry respectively.

<<Line 2:>> Integer [[N]] amount of customers.

<<Next [[N]] Lines:>> Customer’s order, space-separated string(s) consisting of Vanilla, Chocolate and/or Strawberry.
data.outputDescription:
{{Vanilla}}, {{Chocolate}}, and/or {{Strawberry}}, or {{Hired}}
Outputs with multiple flavours should be space-separated and ordered in the same manner as seen above.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

John’s ice cream shop has three different flavours of ice cream: Vanilla, Chocolate, and Strawberry. Customers can only get a maximum of one of each flavour per order. Everyday, before opening, John measures how many scoops of ice cream of each flavour there’s in stock.

However, recently the sales ledger has shown that more ice cream is being sold than there is in stock. John suspects recent applicants on trial-runs have been cheating the customers out of ice cream by giving them smaller scoops, in order to get ahead of the competition.

John has asked you to write some code for him, in order to help catch the candidates red-handed!

If at the end of the day more scoops of ice cream of any flavour(s) have been sold than should be available, output the name of the flavour(s), otherwise output Hired.
Input
Line 1: Space-separated integers V, C and S, for the flavours Vanilla, Chocolate and Strawberry respectively.

Line 2: Integer N amount of customers.

Next N Lines: Customer’s order, space-separated string(s) consisting of Vanilla, Chocolate and/or Strawberry.
Output
Vanilla, Chocolate, and/or Strawberry, or Hired
Outputs with multiple flavours should be space-separated and ordered in the same manner as seen above.
Constraints
Example
Input
3 2 2
5
Vanilla Strawberry
Chocolate
Strawberry
Vanilla Chocolate
Strawberry Chocolate
Output
Chocolate Strawberry
